intro: Mesophlebion hallieri, commonly known as the Halli's mesophlebion, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific alpine regions. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with pale greenish-yellow petals, which bloom during the short summer season. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and requires full sunlight to grow. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
